summation_rule: Expenses are typically debit balances (positive). Sum them algebraically. Impairment of assets should be excluded from this note as it's reported separately.
categories: Depreciation on property, plant and equipment (refer note 4)

impairment.description: EXCLUDE 'impairment of assets' - this is reported separately in the P&L and not part of regular depreciation

additional_instructions:
Depreciation and amortisation are non-cash expenses that allocate the cost of assets over their useful lives.

**Depreciation on property, plant and equipment** includes:
- GL 6011/00000 DEPRECIATION OF LAB EQUIPMENT (major component)
- GL 9D01/00000 DEPRECIATION (general depreciation)

Note: These GLs share the same Ind AS Minor 'Depreciation on property, plant and equipment (refer note 4)'

**Depreciation on right of use assets** includes:
- Dep on ROU (Depreciation on Right-of-Use assets under Ind AS 116)

IMPORTANT EXCLUSION:
- GL 9D01/00001 'IMPAIRMENT OF ASSETS' should NOT be included in this note. Impairment is a separate exceptional/other expense item and should be reported separately in the P&L statement.

Include cross-references to Note 4A (PPE) and Note 4B (ROU Assets). The note structure follows Schedule III requirements for depreciation disclosure.
